defs: = ತತ್ತರದರಿ.
= ತತ್ತಳ1.
to boil with a vehement bubbling sound.
the state of boiling vehemently with bubbling sound.
to tread heavily as to crush (something) into a shapeless mass.
the hard-shelled, oval or round reproductive body produced by a female bird, fish, reptile, etc. containing nutritive food and protective envelopes for a new individual; an egg.
the tree Garceinia indica (=G. purpurea) of Guttifereae family.
its sour fruit.
to put (oneself) with another to become one or a cohesive combination.
to clasp (another) in one's arms; to blend, mingle or associate oneself with cohesively.
the act of joining, mixing, associating oneself with another; the condition of being so.
a part or portion of a whole that belongs or is allotted to an individual; a share.
ತತ್ತು ಮಾಡಿಸು tattu māḍisu to cause to unite, associate or blend.
an instance or the fact of tripping or missing one's step in walking, running, etc.; a falling top forward; stumble.
liability to injury, damage, etc.; danger; peril.
(a pronoun used as a noun, meaning) the Supreme; the God; He.
ತತ್ತಾಗು tattāgu to become one with the God.
one who keeps company with another; a companion.
that quality of association of two or more persons, things, that is cohesive.
to unite, associate oneself with.
the act of uniting, associating, blending (different things) together.
= ತತ್ತ್ವ.
the state of being perfectly united with the Ultimate and Supreme Principle.
that which actually is or is really true; the fundamental truth; reality.
that which makes something what it is; the intrinsic, fundamental nature or most important quality (of something).
any of the five substances (earth, water, air, fire, and ether or space) (or, according to some, four substances without ether) believed to constitute all physical matter.
any of the three broadly classified basic qualities (being sattva, rajas and tamas).
(phil.) according to Sānkhya system, any of the twenty-five basic elements.
a symbol for the number twenty-five.
an accepted or professed rule of action or conduct or a personal or specific basis of conduct or management; a principle.
a fundamental, primary or general law or truth from which others are derived.
what is intended to be or actually is, expressed or indicated; signification; meaning; import.
(rhet.) a kind of figure of speech in which two or more meanings are suggested by a single word or phrase.
(mus.) a slow pace or rhythm.
the Supreme being the active and fundamental principle.
a man who knows the true nature of things, nature, Brahman, etc.
a man who lives by or expounds a system of philosophy; a man who sees visions; a prophet, seer or philosopher.
knowledge of the truth; a thorough knowledge of the principles of philosophy or science.
= ತತ್ತ್ವಜ್ಞ.
a woman who knows the true nature of things, nature, Brahman, etc.
a woman who lives by or expounds a system of philosophy or who sees visions; a prophet, seer or philosopher.
= ತತ್ತ್ವಜ್ಞ.
the way, manner, disposition or process of or suited to philosophy.
= ತತ್ತ್ವಜ್ಞ.

= ತತ್ತ್ವಪ್ರತಿಪಾದನೆ.
a propounding of a principle, philosophy, etc.
(phil.) a significant sentence in philosophy meaning that the knower is not different from, but the same as, the knowable, i.e. the Supreme; 'thou art one with the Supreme'; 'thou art That'.
the occult essence of philosophical principle or the True Being.
= ತತ್ತ್ವಜ್ಞ.

philosophy - a) a search for a general understanding of values and reality by chiefly speculative rather than observational means; b) a discipline comprising as its core logic, aesthetics, ethics, metaphysics, and epistemology for the analysis of the principles underlying conduct, thought, knowledge, and the nature of the universe; c) pursuit of wisdom; d) a system of analysis of the grounds of and concepts expressing fundamental beliefs.
a kind of songs used to convey moral, religious or metaphysical concepts in lucid manner.
surpassing, not being subject to, religious, metaphysical principles.
he who is beyond the limits of the philosophical principles.
she who is beyond the limits of the philosophical principles.
a person who is qualified for receiving religious or metaphysical knowledge.
the realisation of philosophical or religious truth or principles.
the quality or state of being real; reality; fact.
= ತತ್ತ್ವಜ್ಞಾನ.
to shine brightly.
to be afraid of; to get bewildered or confounded.
to boil with bubbles and a bubbling sound.
that follows; following; subsequent.
secondary or minor, but usu. associated.
paying the entire attention to; wholly occupied by or interested in; absorbed.
zealously devoted to.
(usu. in compositions) a man who is engrossed in, devotedly given to.
the fact, state or quality of being sincere, ardently dedicated and loyal; total devotion.
the fact, state or quality of being totally absorbed or engrossed in.
the Supreme Lord.
one of the five faces of Śiva.
(gram.) a class of compounds in which the second of the two words compounded being prominent and qualified by the first one without losing its grammatical independence and literary meaning.
(usu. in compositions) a woman who is engrossed in, devotedly given to.
made or meant for the particular end or case at hand without consideration of general or wider application.
preceding a particular event, time, etc.

especially; particularly; specifically.

of, relating to, based on or characterised by metaphysics or philosophy.

the condition of lacking or being not available; lack; absence; deficiency.

ತತ್ವಾರವಾಗು tatvāravāgu to be wanted; to be lacking or not available; ಹೆಸರು ಕ್ಷೀರಸಾಗರಭಟ್ಟ, ಮನೆಯಲ್ಲಿ ಮಜ್ಜಿಗೆಗೆ ತತ್ವಾರ hesaru kṣīrasāgara bhaṭṭa, maneyalli majjigege tatvāra (prov.) his second name is king, working as a menial.

Buddhism, a religion founded by Gautama Buddha in India in 6th century b.c. (and later spread to China, Burma, Japan, Tibet, and parts of southeast Asia), holding that suffering in life caused by unabated desire can be overcome through enlightenment and self-denial which enable one to escape from endless sequence of births and deaths to which all beings are otherwise subject.
(basically a sentence, meaning) may it be so! so be it!.
the quality or state of being true or being in accordance with experience, facts or reality; conformity with fact; truth.
